status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: All of the ObjectInspectors given to SerDe's by FileSinkOperator have virtual column names. Since the files are part of tables, Hive knows the column names. For self-describing file formats like ORC, having the real column names will improve the understandability.

comments.body:
This patch:
* separates the type description functionality from object inspectors.
* for hive record writers, use the table column names and types
* simplify the code for finding columns for the bloom filters
* take a first pass at the orc q files results update
I've uploaded it to review board https://reviews.apache.org/r/38190/

ATTACHMENT ID: 12754724 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~owen.omalley] Can this change be made generic up top at FSOp layer? I am attaching a patch that does the same in FSOp and using the dest table's Object Inspector. I am not sure if we have to go through whole lot of TypeDescription changes.
[~owen.omalley] Left some comments in RB.

This version:
* includes all of the unit test files
* reduces the api changes to Writer and WriterOptions so that we add a setSchema that is optional and defaults to the schema for the ObjectInspector.
I'm worried about building a completely synthetic ObjectInspector. I iterated the patch to make fewer api changes.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12756087 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

In the previous iteration, I updated the writer version to a new value, which exposed a few more issues. In particular, we didn't have a way for readers to know that the writer had a bug fix from the future. One of the test cases used the same OrcFile.WriterOptions and called inspector a second time. The previous iteration set the schema on the first call and didn't change it on the second call.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12761148 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Left some more comments in RB.

Ok, I added the changes to TypeDescription that Prasanth asked for. In particular, I added a toJson method that prints the detailed (and formatted) print out of the type. I also changed the constructors to be more to use withPrecision, withScale, and withMaxLength for the primitive types that can have attributes.

After thinking about it more, I undid the change to TreeWriter.write's interface and just added both the inspector and schema to the constructors. That let me most of the write methods the same.
Updated the results of 4 qfile tests that had gone out of date.
LGTM, +1 pending tests

ATTACHMENT ID: 12762463 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
The first two tests pass locally with the patch rebased to master. The last two tests are unrelated and fail on master without the patch.
I just committed this. Thanks, for the review Prasanth!

[~owen.omalley] is there a reason proto on branch-2/master says "only in Hive 2"? 
I.e. is there a reason why this cannot be backported to branch-1 if needed?
